longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for a minimum of 6 months beyond the period of
  intended stay. 
 - Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
   valid for a minimum of 3 months beyond the period of
   intended stay when arriving at Basra (BSR). 
 - Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
   valid on arrival when arriving at Erbil (EBL) or
   Sulaymaniyah (ISU).  

Visa required, except for Holders of a signed and stamped
letter issued by the Ministry of Interior of Iraq if arriving
at Baghdad (BGW), Basra (BSR) or Najaf (NJF) . 
Visa required, except for Holders of a signed and stamped
letter issued by the Ministry of Interior of the Kurdistan
Regional Government if arriving at Erbil (EBL) and
Sulaymaniyah (ISU). . 
Visa Issuance:
Visa required, except for Nationals of Slovenia can obtain a
visa on arrival at Erbil (EBL) and Sulaymaniyah (ISU) for a
max. stay of 15 days. Extension possible. 
- Business managers, investors, international experts, oil
  company managers or representatives traveling on business
  can obtain a visa on arrival at Basra (BSR) if holding
  return/onward tickets and passports valid at least 6 months
  from date of arrival . 
- Former nationals of Iraq if passport clearly states that
  place of birth is in Iraq or if holding an ID Card issued by
  Iraq can obtain a visa on arrival at Baghdad (BGW) or Basra
  (BSR). 
- Former nationals of Iraq or those of Iraqi origin holding an
  ID Card issued by Iraq can obtain a visa on arrival at Najaf
  (NJF). Those not holding an ID Card
  
  
- Passengers under 18 years of age traveling with parents who
  hold Iraqi passports or one of the parent holds an Iraqi
  passport can obtain visa on arrival at Baghdad (BGW) or
  Basra (BSR) airports.
Minors:
- WARNING! In accordance with European Union (EU) Legislation,
  all minors who are nationals of Slovenia will be expected to
  hold their own passport or National ID Card (where
  applicable) when departing from Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus,
  Romania or a Schengen Member State . 
Additional Information:
- Group visas 
Warning:
- Holders of passports containing an Israeli stamp or visa
  will be refused entry in Iraq. This restriction does not
  apply at Erbil (EBL).
- Passports and/or passport replacing documents of all
  visitors traveling to Baghdad (BGW) or Basra (BSR) must
  contain at least 2 unused visa pages
   
- Nationals of Slovenia who have visited Congo (Dem. Rep.),
  Guinea, Liberia, Nigeria, Senegal and Sierra Leone within 3
  months prior to arrival in Iraq are subject to screening and
  health check. Exempt are holders of diplomatic passports
vaccination:
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving within 6
days after leaving or transiting countries with risk of yellow
fever transmission For details, click here.

Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 6 months of age.
- Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
  transmission provided not leaving the transit areas.
Recommended:
- Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk, exclusively to P. vivax,
  is limited and may exist from May to November inclusive in
  areas in the north below 1500m (Duhok, Erbil and Sulaimaniya
  provinces). Recommended prevention in risk areas: none.
